title: Boy, 5, is killed while riding his bicycle on the footpath with his father
text:
A five-year-old has been hit and killed by a car turning out of a driveway.

The boy was riding a bike along the footpath with his father on Ross River Road in Townsville, Queensland, when the vehicle hit him at 7.30pm on Tuesday.

Members of the public tried to give the child first aid before he was treated by paramedics.

A five-year-old has been hit and killed by a car turning out of a driveway (pictured)

He was rushed to Townsville Hospital, but couldn't be revived.

Queensland Police are still investigating, but a spokesperson told Daily Mail Australia the tragedy appeared to be an accident.

'It all appears very innocent - it looks as though a young boy was just riding a bike and was tragically hit,' a spokesperson said.

Police have urged anyone with dashcam footage to come forward.
description: The boy was riding along the footpath with his father in Queensland, when the vehicle struck the boy on Tuesday night.
authors: Charlotte Karp For Daily Mail Australia
